column5: Nice drive in this morning.  Plows where out last night.  But the roads where still covered, and I have a 14 month old in the back, with my summer tires on...

Nice drive in this morning.  Plows where out last night.  But the roads where still covered, and I have a 14 month old in the back, with my summer tires on... Plows? Ok, you guys must have got a lot more than us then.  The phones at the tire shops are gonna ring off the hook today
Mine are on already.LOL  Sometimes the weatherman is right.LOL
We had our first frost of the fall here last night in the sunny south.
My ride in.  About 10 minutes north of Barrie on hwy 93.   Hit the Barrie sign on 93, and literally, the roads where dry.
I was going to say, nothing in Barrie except for a light dusting..  OP's pics look like frost not snow, lol!
Yeah, I remember that being the case last year 1 time!!LOL
It was a very light dusting in the last photo. The others are just frost.  You really got hit Nick.
Still snowing here too.  Ill be ready in a month.
Hey Caster...that's an interesting way to stack wood. how do you start the pile? if you don't mind can you take pictures when you start the next pile?  Cheers'  Curt
Those pictures make my stomach hurt. IT IS TO EARLY for white stuff. Thankfully on the map there is enough distance I will be saved the agony of ice and snow for a little while longer.lol   Art
Thankfully on the map there is enough distance I will be saved the agony of ice and snow for a little while longer.lol   Art  It'll get really scary if you zoom out, Art.

Hey Caster...that's an interesting way to stack wood. how do you start the pile? if you don't mind can you take pictures when you start the next pile?  Cheers'  Curt http://woodheat.org/firewood-follies.html

I was up on the Saugeen (Southapton Ontario) last week.  Arrived at first light to find about an inch of snow on the ground. Burned off in a couple of hours. I'm sure there will be lots more to come in the not too distant future.
It'll get really scary if you zoom out, Art. O.K. I did it and you are correct. Some days a little knowledge is a scary thing bud.    Art
that birch will be nice in the stove and nice bunch of chopping blocks. mine disintegrated lol

Hey Caster...that's an interesting way to stack wood. how do you start the pile? if you don't mind can you take pictures when you start the next pile?  Cheers'  Curt Raf posted a good how-to link.  I started stacking a drying my wood this August (standing dead and fresh) and I'm happy and releaved how dry it is. Burns great; in holz hausen I trust.   that birch will be nice in the stove and nice bunch of chopping blocks. mine disintegrated lol I can thank a beaver for dropping several BIG white birch near one of the ponds. That stuff was essentially pre-seasoned in the field for me. I have a good mix of maple, oak, poplar, ash, yellow and white birch. I'm already collecting for next year.
